section-content.Title: Short title, extent and commencement
Content: This Act may be called the Commercial Courts Act, 2015.
It extends to the whole of India.
It shall be deemed to have come into force on the 23rd day of October, 2015.

Definitions.Commercial Appellate Courts: The Commercial Appellate Courts designated under section 3A.

Definitions.Commercial Appellate Division: The Commercial Appellate Division in a High Court constituted under sub-section (1) of section 5.

Definitions.Commercial Court: The Commercial Court constituted under sub-section (1) of section 3.

Definitions.Commercial dispute: A dispute arising out of ordinary transactions of merchants, bankers, financiers, traders, and other commercial matters including but not limited to: mercantile documents, export/import of merchandise or services, admiralty and maritime law, aircraft and equipment, carriage of goods, construction contracts, intellectual property rights, etc.

Definitions.Commercial Division: The Commercial Division in a High Court constituted under sub-section (1) of section 4.

Definitions.District Judge: Shall have the same meaning as assigned to it in clause (a) of article 236 of the Constitution of India.

Definitions.Document: Any matter expressed or described upon any substance by means of letters, figures, marks, or electronic means intended to be used for recording that matter.

Definitions.Notification: A notification published in the Official Gazette, and the expression 'notify' shall be construed accordingly.

Definitions.Schedule: The Schedule appended to the Act.

Definitions.Specified Value: The value of the subject matter in respect of a suit as determined under section 12, which shall not be less than three lakh rupees or such higher value as may be notified by the Central Government.

chapter-title: Constitution of Commercial Courts, Commercial Divisions, and Commercial Appellate Divisions

section-content.Title: Constitution of Commercial Courts
Content: The State Government, after consultation with the concerned High Court, may constitute Commercial Courts at the district level.
The State Government may specify the pecuniary value for such courts.

chapter-title: Constitution of Commercial Courts, Commercial Divisions, and Commercial Appellate Divisions

section-content.Title: Designation of Commercial Appellate Courts
Content: The State Government may designate Commercial Appellate Courts at the District Judge level.

chapter-title: Constitution of Commercial Courts, Commercial Divisions, and Commercial Appellate Divisions

section-content.Title: Constitution of Commercial Division of High Court
Content: The Chief Justice of the High Court may constitute Commercial Divisions in High Courts having ordinary original civil jurisdiction.

chapter-title: Constitution of Commercial Courts, Commercial Divisions, and Commercial Appellate Divisions

section-content.Title: Constitution of Commercial Appellate Division
Content: The Chief Justice of the High Court may constitute Commercial Appellate Divisions in High Courts.

chapter-title: Constitution of Commercial Courts, Commercial Divisions, and Commercial Appellate Divisions

section-content.Title: Jurisdiction of Commercial Court
Content: The Commercial Court shall have jurisdiction over commercial disputes of Specified Value.

chapter-title: Constitution of Commercial Courts, Commercial Divisions, and Commercial Appellate Divisions

section-content.Title: Jurisdiction of Commercial Divisions of High Courts
Content: All suits and applications relating to commercial disputes of a Specified Value filed in a High Court shall be heard by the Commercial Division.

chapter-title: Constitution of Commercial Courts, Commercial Divisions, and Commercial Appellate Divisions

section-content.Title: Bar against revision application or petition against an interlocutory order
Content: No civil revision application or petition shall be entertained against any interlocutory order of a Commercial Court.

chapter-title: Constitution of Commercial Courts, Commercial Divisions, and Commercial Appellate Divisions

section-content.Title: Jurisdiction in respect of arbitration matters
Content: Commercial Courts shall have jurisdiction over arbitration matters involving commercial disputes of Specified Value.

section-content.Title: Determination of Specified Value
Content: Specified Value shall be determined based on the relief sought in the suit or application.
This includes recovery of money, market value of property, and other intangible rights.

section-content.Title: Pre-Institution Mediation and Settlement
Content: A suit that does not require urgent interim relief shall not be instituted unless pre-institution mediation has been exhausted.

section-content.Title: Appeals from decrees of Commercial Courts and Commercial Divisions
Content: Appeals may be made to the Commercial Appellate Court or Commercial Appellate Division of the High Court.

section-content.Title: Expeditious disposal of appeals
Content: Appeals should be disposed of within six months from the date of filing.

section-content.Title: Transfer of pending cases
Content: All pending suits of Specified Value in civil courts shall be transferred to Commercial Courts.

chapter-title: Amendments to the Provisions of the Code of Civil Procedure, 1908

section-content.Title: Amendments to the Code of Civil Procedure, 1908
Content: Provisions of the CPC shall stand amended in their application to suits in respect of commercial disputes.

section-content.Title: Collection and disclosure of data
Content: Statistical data regarding suits and applications filed and disposed of by Commercial Courts shall be maintained and published.

section-content.Title: Power of High Court to issue directions
Content: The High Court may issue practice directions to supplement the provisions of this Act.

section-content.Title: Infrastructure facilities
Content: The State Government shall provide necessary infrastructure to facilitate the working of Commercial Courts.

section-content.Title: Training and continuous education
Content: The State Government may establish facilities for the training of Judges appointed to Commercial Courts.

section-content.Title: Act to have overriding effect
Content: The provisions of this Act shall have an overriding effect notwithstanding anything inconsistent with any other law.

section-content.Title: Power of Central Government to make rules
Content: The Central Government may make rules for carrying out the provisions of this Act.

section-content.Title: Power to remove difficulties
Content: The Central Government may make provisions to remove difficulties in giving effect to the Act.

section-content.Title: Repeal and savings
Content: The Commercial Courts Ordinance, 2015 is hereby repealed.
